Welcome to the OAI Track! Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(3) The OpenAPI Initiative (OAI)

  • The organization behind OpenAPI (and other specifications)
  • Works under the umbrella of the Linux Foundation
  • Technical work is open to everyone
  • Members support OAI and decide on the strategic direction


OAI User Stories

Outline (OAI User Stories)

  1. Welcome to the OAI Track! [5]
    1. OAI User Stories [4]

OAI User Stories Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(5) WIIFM: Business and Organization Value

As business or organization leader
I want well-defined and usable digital interfaces for partners and the public
so that I can more easily change and scale my value streams.


OAI User Stories Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(6) WIIFM: API Developers

As an API developer
I want to describe the product I am going to implement
so that I can use various tools throughout the API lifecycle.


OAI User Stories Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(7) WIIFM: API Consumers

As an API consumer
I want APIs to have standardized descriptions
so that I can easily understand and consume the products I depend on.


OAI User Stories Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(8) WIIFM: Platform Builders

As an API platform builder
I want to support standardized description formats
so that all producers and consumers speak the same language.


The 100,000,000,000 lb Gorilla

The 100,000,000,000 lb Gorilla Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(10) What Does AI Need?



The 100,000,000,000 lb Gorilla Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(11) AI Consuming APIs

  • How can I search and select capabilities?
  • Are capabilities at the right semantic level for AI?
  • Does OpenAPI contain all necessary information?
    • Enriching OpenAPI for what it can currently represent
    • Extending/evolving OpenAPI to better serve AI needs


The 100,000,000,000 lb Gorilla Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(12) Consumers of AI-backed APIs

  • Does this API use AI at runtime?
  • Is the result deterministic or variable?
  • Which model is used and can I choose it?
  • Will my input be stored or used for training?
  • Can I influence or opt out of that behavior?

Welcome New OpenAPI Versions! Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(14) Main Versions of OpenAPI

  • December 2015: 2.0 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v2.0.html] (previously Swagger 2.0)
  • July 2017: 3.0 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0.html] (currently at 3.0.4 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.4.html])
  • February 2021: 3.1 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.0.html] (currently at 3.1.2 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.2.html])
  • September 2025: 3.2 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.2.0.html]


Welcome New OpenAPI Versions! Erik Wilde / Lorna Mitchell: Welcome to the OAI Track & Welcome New OpenAPI Versions

(15) Main New Features of OpenAPI 3.2

  • New HTTP methods (including QUERY)
  • Enhanced tag system (hierarchical and multiple tags)
  • Support for streaming media types
  • Updated OAuth support
